title: How to Upload a NASH Certificate in MediRecords
body:
NASH is a Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) solution used to access digital health services such as: Electronic prescribing, My Health Record, Secure messaging. Healthcare Identifiers (HI) Service.
This article will show you how to upload Nash Certificate in MediRecords.
Follow these steps on how to Upload a NASH Certificate in MediRecords
Click More at the top of the page to reveal a drop-down list
Click Settings
Click Configuration Settings
Click the Name of the Practice
Click eHealth
Navigate to (NASH) P12 Certificate File
Click Select File to open a file explorer window
Navigate to the location of the file (called site.p12) and click Select or Open (depending on your OS)
Click Upload File and wait for the certificate to upload
A green tick will appear once the certificate is uploaded
Enter the PIC - Personal Identification Code
Click Save
Once the certificate has been uploaded and saved, the system will automatically add the HPI-O details from the certificate
The HPI-O No., the Certificate Alias Name and the Expiry Date will be auto-populated from the certificate
The HPI-O certificate has now been uploaded.

What certificates do I need? (Health Identifier Service and Claiming)
